lexUnit.name: goblet.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a drinking glass with a foot and a stem

sentence.text: They toast her ` engagement " and Harriet 's deal in red wine out of tall crystal goblets .
High on the moorland wilds , ancient travellers told of meeting with a mysterious stranger who would offer them a golden goblet of wine .
Of the mysterious stranger and his goblet no more was heard until , perhaps , a strange chance discovery early in the last century .
Corbett turned away and picked up the goblet , tasting the full red flavour of Bordeaux .
The goblet was of unknown material , unusual colour and of unfamiliar shape : it was presented to the King .
The Romans believed the amethyst prevented drunkenness and used to drink out of goblets studded with these purple gems .
He presented the Bishop , from the parish , with a crystal goblet engraved with the symbols of the two dioceses .
If these men thought of anything they were longing for plates of hot food , goblets of good strong English ale , and clean soft beds , with a willing wench to share with them .
After a moment , he picked up his water goblet and rinsed his mouth , then spat the rinse back into the glass .

He steers himself into the current of warm air rising above the chandelier , and is carried effortlessly upwards , past floors where people are sitting at little tables and eating ice-cream out of metal goblets .
When a servaton finally appeared , I ordered a goblet of the fuming Paoostyc liquor called Old Sunburst , raised my mask just enough to gulp it , then ordered two more .
Marcus handed her a goblet of scotch and Ted another pint .
He drank and set the goblet down , looking about him again .
He smiled at Riven 's roving stare and raised his goblet in salute .
Sir John stretched over and , despite the hour , filled his wine goblet completely to the brim .
The boy hurried away , rubbing his flaming cheek , as Gaveston sipped from the goblet .
There was a silver goblet in the centre of the cloth .
Throgmorton slurped from his goblet .
On the table near Ruthven stood an empty pewter goblet .
The awards will be presented at the House of Sport on October with each category winner receiving an engraved Wassail goblet donated by sponsors Tyrone Crystal .
Athelstan waited until the slattern had served them with goblets of wine .
